text:
Hi. Question about creating theme's section -templates.

I noticed that there problems when module has Boolean -field in the root level and you change it's default value in section -template.

I use "?developerMode=true" in the page URL to get code from the section and add it to the section -template.

Example field code:
``` enable_top_content=false,```
That "enable_top_content" -field is enabled as default.  When you drag-and-drop the section to page it gives "The value in the field Enable top content is invalid." -error.
Same thing happens if default value is false and you changed it to true in section's code.

Even if there is that error -message =>  module itself works like it should.
Error disappears if I manually enable and then disable the field when editing the module.

Is this a bug or should the "enable_top_content=false," be in different format?

Here is an video about what happens:
<https://www.loom.com/share/5bb353aa9f734c9c959aec61bdad8d2d?sid=6b7e6bfa-6fa8-49d7-bcae-5167eb86e45a>
<@UD53A9UUR> Iâ€™ve run into this as well
thanks for the tag.  will see what i can find out
